text:
Recreations and Hobbies: Children playing in various sections of Brooklyn. View 1 shows several youngsters at a water barrel at Columbia and Sigourney Streets. View 2 details several more collecting firewood from razed shacks on Henry Street. No. 3 is a Plumb Beach scene showing the fire alarm near the Ferry.

1: June 6, 1931
2: August 31, 1934 - Neg #2709
3: July 4, 1935

P. L. Sperr
title: Recreation and hobbies - Children playing.

text:
Sheepshead Bay, southward, from a channel at the foot of Emmons Ave. (right). This is a set of two views which show the east (Plumb Beach) and west side of the channel. Note the row boat ferry near Plumb Beach, and its landing on the Sheepshead Bay side. This was the only means of transportation to the main land prior to the filling in of this area. July 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Sheepshead Bay - Brooklyn - South channel foot - Emmons Avenue.

text:
Plumb Beach Channel, looking south to Plumb Island, from the foot of Noll Ave. in Gerritsen Beach, showing the Plumb Island Ferry. This is a panoramic set of two views.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Plumb Beach Channel - Brooklyn - Plumb Island.
